    Advanced Cross-Validation for Nested Datasets

    nest_cv.Rd

    Provides a flexible and powerful cross-validation strategy for nested datasets, supporting complex machine learning and statistical modeling workflows.

    nest_cv(
  nest_dt,
  v = 10,
  repeats = 1,
  strata = NULL,
  breaks = 4,
  pool = 0.1,
  ...
)

    Arguments

    nest_dt

    A data.frame or data.table containing at least one nested data.frame or data.table column.

    • Supports multi-level nested structures

    • Requires at least one nested data column

    v

    The number of partitions of the data set.

    repeats

    The number of times to repeat the V-fold partitioning.

    strata

    A variable in data (single character or name) used to conduct stratified sampling. When not NULL, each resample is created within the stratification variable. Numeric strata are binned into quartiles.

    breaks

    A single number giving the number of bins desired to stratify a numeric stratification variable.

    pool

    A proportion of data used to determine if a particular group is too small and should be pooled into another group. We do not recommend decreasing this argument below its default of 0.1 because of the dangers of stratifying groups that are too small.

    ...

    These dots are for future extensions and must be empty.

    Value

    Enhanced data.table containing:

    • Original non-nested columns

    • splits: Cross-validation split objects

    • train: Training datasets for each split

    • validate: Validation datasets for each split

    Details

    Cross-Validation Processing Workflow:

    1. Input data validation

    2. Identify nested data columns

    3. Perform cross-validation splits for each nested dataset

    4. Generate training and validation sets

    5. Preserve original non-nested column context

    Key Features:

    • Supports complex nested data structures

    • Flexible stratified sampling strategies

    • High-performance data processing

    • Seamless integration with rsample

    • Preserves original data context

    Note

    Usage Considerations:

    • Input data must contain at least one nested data.frame or data.table

    • Internally converts to data.table for performance optimization

    • Stratification variable must exist in all nested data frames

    • Supports additional parameter passing to rsample::vfold_cv() via ...

    See also

    • rsample::vfold_cv() Underlying cross-validation function

    • rsample::training() Extract training set

    • rsample::testing() Extract test set

    Examples

    dt_nest <- w2l_nest(data = iris, cols2l = 1:2, by = "Species")
nest_cv(nest_dt = dt_nest, v = 2, repeats = 2)
#>             name    Species                    splits      id    id2
#>           <fctr>     <fctr>                    <list>  <char> <char>
#>  1: Sepal.Length     setosa <vfold_split[25x25x50x3]> Repeat1  Fold1
#>  2: Sepal.Length     setosa <vfold_split[25x25x50x3]> Repeat1  Fold2
#>  3: Sepal.Length     setosa <vfold_split[25x25x50x3]> Repeat2  Fold1
#>  4: Sepal.Length     setosa <vfold_split[25x25x50x3]> Repeat2  Fold2
#>  5: Sepal.Length versicolor <vfold_split[25x25x50x3]> Repeat1  Fold1
#>  6: Sepal.Length versicolor <vfold_split[25x25x50x3]> Repeat1  Fold2
#>  7: Sepal.Length versicolor <vfold_split[25x25x50x3]> Repeat2  Fold1
#>  8: Sepal.Length versicolor <vfold_split[25x25x50x3]> Repeat2  Fold2
#>  9: Sepal.Length  virginica <vfold_split[25x25x50x3]> Repeat1  Fold1
#> 10: Sepal.Length  virginica <vfold_split[25x25x50x3]> Repeat1  Fold2
#> 11: Sepal.Length  virginica <vfold_split[25x25x50x3]> Repeat2  Fold1
#> 12: Sepal.Length  virginica <vfold_split[25x25x50x3]> Repeat2  Fold2
#> 13:  Sepal.Width     setosa <vfold_split[25x25x50x3]> Repeat1  Fold1
#> 14:  Sepal.Width     setosa <vfold_split[25x25x50x3]> Repeat1  Fold2
#> 15:  Sepal.Width     setosa <vfold_split[25x25x50x3]> Repeat2  Fold1
#> 16:  Sepal.Width     setosa <vfold_split[25x25x50x3]> Repeat2  Fold2
#> 17:  Sepal.Width versicolor <vfold_split[25x25x50x3]> Repeat1  Fold1
#> 18:  Sepal.Width versicolor <vfold_split[25x25x50x3]> Repeat1  Fold2
#> 19:  Sepal.Width versicolor <vfold_split[25x25x50x3]> Repeat2  Fold1
#> 20:  Sepal.Width versicolor <vfold_split[25x25x50x3]> Repeat2  Fold2
#> 21:  Sepal.Width  virginica <vfold_split[25x25x50x3]> Repeat1  Fold1
#> 22:  Sepal.Width  virginica <vfold_split[25x25x50x3]> Repeat1  Fold2
#> 23:  Sepal.Width  virginica <vfold_split[25x25x50x3]> Repeat2  Fold1
